author: bridge-bot
content:
<protolambda> You can find the amphora testnet config details here: https://github.com/parithosh/consensus-deployment-ansible/tree/master/amphora-testnet/custom_config_data
Note however that we are running the testnet with the "minimal" compile-time preset beacon chain. This means that:
- the minimum committee size is 4 instead of 128.
- the max committees per slot is 4
- the slot time is 6 seconds instead of 12
- the slots / epoch is 8 instead of 32
And it runs 10.000 validators on this test setting (!!!), so that means we have:
- full-capacity attestation work, with committees of size 10k/8/4 = 312 validators
- only 6/3=2 seconds to aggregate 10k/8=1250 single-participant attestations into 4 aggregates instead of nearly 64 like mainnet. The execution engine also needs to process the block within a similar time window, before it can be attested.
- very inefficient usage of gossip topics; with only 4 committees per slot, there are 3x as many attestations per topic than on mainnet (247000/32/64=120 vs 312)
The minimal preset was nice during the event for a fast debug feedback loop, but was a poor decision for the testnet in hindsight, as we've put the network in an unnecessarily (and unrealistically) stressful situation. The mainnet preset can handle 250k+ validators like on mainnet, but minimal is meant for testing, with like 1k validators, or commonly < 256.
The good news is that the network is still kind of keeping up with this; there are more missed block-proposals, but attestation inclusion and remaining synced nodes are still good enough to hover around the 2/3 participation.
Feel free to experiment with the network, but let's start a new one soon with mainnet-like preset (Prater and Pyrmont have this too), to properly scale.

author: bridge-bot
content:
<protolambda> Merge interop testnet UPDATE:
- The Amphora testnet with the current minimal testing preset does not scale as well as the mainnet preset. We are going to deprecate it in favor of a new more stable testnet with the mainnet preset. It will shut down around Thu morning UTC.
- A new Merge testnet will be started at 12:00 UTC Thursday (noon, == 2pm CET), aimed at providing stability for sync/interop testing, with clients that are running the most stable on the current Amphora network as backbone. We are going for 20.000 validators, mainnet preset (less stress per slot). And with explorer + faucet for deposits + deposit contract in genesis.
- In a month, we would like to launch a larger Merge devnet with better client distribution, once development stabilizes more.
- For merge devs: the older alpha devnet is going to shut down later today: please use the amphora testnet instead.

content:
<sigpaul> Alright, I have a confession to make. Some of you already know this, but it's important for my healing that I share it. Here we go...
Lighthouse presently accepts the TTD override parameter as non-0x-prefixed hex. So, if you do --terminal-total-difficulty-override 16, you're actually passing 22 decimal (not 16) ðŸ˜¬ðŸ¤¢ðŸ¤®
I know this wasted some time, so my apologies for this one. I want to fix this so we only accept decimal. To do that, I'm going to merge this PR: https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/pull/2676
Unfortunately, I can't do this in a backwards-compatible way. So, after I merge this PR, the merge-f2f branch of Lighthouse will start parsing --terminal-total-difficulty-override 16 as decimal 16 (*not* decimal 22). This is probably going to break some configs. This is relevant to @parithoshj and @protolambda, perhaps others.
